definition: to be born under an ill star
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: It is useless for a girl to quarrel with fate because she is not a boy.
sentences.chinese: 女孩子因自己非男孩而自怨命苦是無用的。

sentences.english: Ah, I said, when we these children can easily lives?
sentences.chinese: 哎，我說，何時我們這些命苦的小孩才能輕鬆呢？

sentences.english: It does no good for you to repine at your unhappy lot.
sentences.chinese: 你埋怨自己命苦是沒有用的。

sentences.english: Hey, I said, when our children to these Bitter relaxed?
sentences.chinese: 哎，我說，何時我們這些命苦的小孩才能輕鬆呢？

sentences.english: Good depressed, good knot, losers run into me, Oh, Bitter ah.
sentences.chinese: 好鬱悶，好糾結，啥事都碰上我了，唉，命苦呀。

sentences.english: He often bemoaned his sad fate.

definition: to be born under an unlucky star (usu. of women)/to be born unlucky
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to live in plenty without appreciating it (idiom); not to know when one is well off
pinyin: shen1 zai4 fu2 zhong1 bu4 zhi1 fu2

definition: disaster one brings on oneself/to be reponsible for something bad that happens to oneself/to have only oneself to blame
